item.title: A Beginner's Guide to HTTP Requests
item.description: A Beginner’s Guide to HTTP Requests What Are HTTP Requests? HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) is the foundation of communication on the web. When you access a website, your browser sends an HTTP request to the server hosting the site, and the server responds with the requested resources or an error message. HTTP requests are categorized into methods, and the serverâ€™s response includes status codes indicating the result of the request.
